description: Understanding absolute value and solving absolute value equations and inequalities.
title: Absolute value

description: Adding and subtracting positive and negative whole numbers. Starts with 1+1=2 and covers carrying, borrowing, and word problems.
title: Addition and subtraction

description: Videos about how government works in the United States.
title: American Civics

description: Identifying, measuring, and calculating angles.
title: Angles

standalone_title: Art History: 1400-1500 Renaissance in Italy and the North
title: 1400-1500 Renaissance in Italy and the North

standalone_title: Art History: 1500-1600 End of the Renaissance and the Reformation
title: 1500-1600 End of the Renaissance and the Reformation

standalone_title: Art History: 1907-1960 Age of Global Conflict
title: 1907-1960 Age of Global Conflict

description: Videos on how banks work and how money is created.
title: Banking and Money

description: Understanding and solving exponents without algebra.
title: Exponents (basic)

description: Finding perimeter, volume, and area of basic shapes without algebra.
title: Basic geometry

description: Solving and writing ratios and proportions without algebra.
title: Ratios and proportions (basic)

description: Covers topics seen in a first year college or high school biology course.
title: Biology

description: Random logic puzzles and brain teasers.  Fun to do and useful for many job interviews!
title: Brain Teasers

description: Sal working through the 53 problems from the practice test available at http://www.cde.ca.gov/ta/tg/hs/documents/mathpractest.pdf for the CAHSEE (California High School Exit Examination).  Clearly useful if you're looking to take that exam.  Probably still useful if you want to make sure you have a solid understanding of basic high school math.
title: CAHSEE

description: Topics covered in the first two or three semesters of college calculus.  Everything from limits to derivatives to integrals to vector calculus. Should understand the topics in the pre-calculus playlist first (the limit videos are in both playlists)
title: Calculus

description: Sal works through the problems from the <a href=
>CA Standards released questions. It is best first to go through the
>algebra topic first as it is more comprehensive.
title: Algebra I

description: Sal works through 80 questions taken from the <a href=
>California Standards Test for Algebra II. If you struggle with these you can get more help by viewing the
>algebra topic and completing its exercises.
title: Algebra II

description: Sal does the 80 problems from the released questions from the <a href=
>California Standards Test for Geometry. Basic understanding of
>algebra is necessary. Go to the
>geometry topic for a comprehensive treatment of the subject.
title: Geometry

description: Videos on chemistry (roughly covering a first-year high school or college course).
title: Chemistry

description: Finding measurements and applying and proving circle theorems.
title: Circles

description: Example problems from random math competitions
title: Competition Math

description: Understanding and solving equations with imaginary numbers.
title: Complex numbers

description: Introduction to programming and computer science
title: Computer Science

description: Identifying and graphing circles, ellipses, parabolas, and hyperbolas.
title: Conic sections

description: Videos attempting to grasp a little bit about our Universe (many of the topics associated with
title: Cosmology and Astronomy

description: Videos on the causes and effects of the credit crisis/crunch.
title: Credit Crisis

description: Videos about currency exchange
title: Currency

description: Discussions of economic topics and how they relate to current events.
title: Current Economics

description: Understanding decimals conceptually, using operations with decimals, rounding and estimating with decimals, and converting decimals.
title: Decimals

description: Topics covered in a first year course in differential equations.  Need to understand basic differentiation and integration from Calculus playlist before starting here.
title: Differential Equations

description: Solving exponential and radical expressions and equations. Using scientific notation and significant figures.
title: Exponents and Radicals

description: Understanding and finding factors and multiples. After these videos, you'll be ready for fractions.
title: Factors and multiples

description: Videos on finance and macroeconomics
title: Core Finance

description: Understanding fractions conceptually, using operations with fractions, and converting fractions.
title: Fractions

description: Identifying, solving, and graphing various types of functions.
title: Functions

description: Sal works through 155 data sufficiency problems in the GMAC GMAT Review book (so using real GMAT problems).  Buy the book, then watch the videos.
title: Data Sufficiency

description: Sal works through the 249 math problem solving questions in the official GMAC GMAT book.
title: Problem Solving

description: Videos on the Geithner Plan to solve the banking crisis.
title: Geithner Plan

description: Videos about medicine and the healthcare system
title: Healthcare and Medicine

description: The history of the world (eventually)!
title: History

description: Questions from previous IIT JEEs
title: IIT JEE

description: Understanding the purpose, notation, and building blocks of geometry.
title: Introduction to Euclidean geometry

description: Videos exploring why algebra was developed and how it helps us explain our world.
title: Introduction to Algebra

description: Collection of interviews with and presentations by Salman Khan.  Also a few other mentions of Khan Academy at other talks.
title: Talks and Interviews

description: Matrices, vectors, vector spaces, transformations.  Covers all topics in a first year college linear algebra course.  This is an advanced course normally taken by science or engineering majors after taking at least two semesters of calculus (although calculus really isn't a prereq) so don't confuse this with regular high school algebra.
title: Linear Algebra

description: Understanding the coordinate plane, slope, and intercept. Writing, solving, and graphing linear equations and inequalities.
title: Graphing linear equations and inequalities

description: Understanding and solving logarithms, including natural logs.
title: Logarithms

description: Topics covered in a traditional college level introductory macroeconomics course
title: Macroeconomics

description: Understanding and solving matrices.
title: Matrices

description: Topics covered in a traditional college level introductory microeconomics course
title: Microeconomics

description: Multiplying and dividing positive and negative whole numbers, understanding place value, and rounding numbers.
title: Multiplication and division

description: Understanding and using negative numbers.
title: Negative numbers

description: Defining and using the commutative, associative, distributive, identity, and inverse properties.
title: Number properties

description: Defining the order in which operations are done in expressions.
title: Order of operations

description: Topics covered in college organic chemistry course.  Basic understanding of basic high school or college chemistry assumed
title: Organic Chemistry

description: Videos to help understand the bailout.
title: Paulson Bailout

description: Understanding, solving, and converting percents.
title: Percents

description: Projectile motion, mechanics and electricity and magnetism.  Solid understanding of algebra and a basic understanding of trigonometry necessary.
title: Physics

description: Identifying types of quadrilaterals, finding measurements, and applying and proving postulates.
title: Polygons, quadrilaterals, and parallelograms

description: Using polynomial expressions and factoring polynomials.
title: Polynomials

description: Non-trigonometry pre-calculus topics.  Solid understanding of all of the topics in the
playlist should make this playlist pretty digestible.
title: Precalculus

description: Basic probability.  Should have a reasonable grounding in basic algebra before watching.
title: Probability

description: Solving quadratics through factoring, completing the square, graphing, and the quadratic equation.
title: Quadratics

description: Solving and writing algebraic ratios and proportions. Solving rational equations.
title: Ratios & proportions

description: I am going to work through every problem in the College Board
You should take the practice tests on your own, grade them and then use these videos to understand the problems you didn't get or review.  Have fun!
title: SAT Math

description: We will (eventually)do all of the lectures in the Singapore Math curriculum (which we like).  You can follow along through the workbooks available at singaporemath.com
title: Singapore Math

description: Solving one-step and multi-step equations in one variable.
title: Solving linear equations

description: Solving and writing one-step, multi-step, and compound inequalities in one variable.
title: Solving linear inequalities

description: Introduction to statistics.  Will eventually cover all of the major topics in a first-year statistics course (not there yet!)
title: Statistics

description: Solving a system of equations or inequalities in two variables by elimination, substitution, and graphing.
title: Systems of equations and inequalities

description: Identifying types of triangles, using principles of similarity and congruence, and applying and proving triangle postulates.
title: Triangles

description: Videos on trigonometry.  Watch the
playlist first if you have trouble understanding the topics covered here.
title: Trigonometry

description: Building blocks and case studies on the financial analysis and valuation of public equities.
title: Valuation and Investing

description: All of the sources of funding (capital) for a business.
title: Venture Capital and Capital Markets

description: Recreational mathematics and inspirational videos by resident mathemusician Vi Hart
title: Vi Hart

description: Sal does the 80 problems from the released questions from the California Standards Test for Geometry.  Basic understanding of Algebra I necessary.
title: Worked Examples

description: Select problems from ck12.org's Algebra 1 FlexBook (Open Source Textbook).  This is a good playlist to review if you want to make sure you have a good understanding of all of the major topics in Algebra I.
title: ck12.org Algebra 1 Examples
